name: G√©n√©rer du contenu multi-plateforme avec OpenAI, Tavily Research et Supabase Storage
description:
# G√©n√©rateur de page de contenu automatis√© avec AI, Tavily Research et Supabase Storage

![workflow1.png](fileId:2626)

> **‚ö†Ô∏è Avertissement d'auto-h√©bergement** : Ce mod√®le n√©cessite une installation n8n auto-h√©berg√©e et des identifiants de service externes (OpenAI, Tavily, Google Drive, NextCloud, Supabase). Il ne peut pas fonctionner sur n8n Cloud en raison des exigences de d√©pendance.

## Aper√ßu

Transformez des entr√©es de sujet simples en contenu professionnel et multi-plateforme automatiquement. Ce flux de travail combine la g√©n√©ration de contenu aliment√©e par l'IA avec une recherche intelligente et une int√©gration de stockage transparente pour cr√©er du contenu de site Web, des articles de blog et des pages de destination optimis√©es pour diff√©rents publics.

## Caract√©ristiques cl√©s

- **Recherche automatis√©e** : Utilise la recherche avanc√©e de Tavily pour rassembler des informations pertinentes et √† jour
- **Contenu multi-plateforme** : G√©n√®re du contenu optimis√© pour les sites Web, les blogs et les pages de destination
- **Gestion des images** : T√©l√©charge depuis Google Drive et t√©l√©charge sur NextCloud avec g√©n√©ration d'URL publique
- **Int√©gration de base de donn√©es** : Stocke tout le contenu dans Supabase pour un acc√®s facile
- **Gestion des erreurs** : Flux de travail de gestion des erreurs int√©gr√© pour la fiabilit√©
- **Optimisation du contenu** : Strat√©gie de contenu pilot√©e par l'IA avec analyse des tendances et optimisation SEO

## Services et API requis

### Services principaux
- **n8n** : Instance auto-h√©berg√©e (requise)
- **OpenAI** : Acc√®s √† l'API GPT-4 pour la g√©n√©ration de contenu
- **Tavily** : API de recherche pour la d√©couverte de contenu
- **Google Drive** : Stockage et r√©cup√©ration d'images
- **Google Sheets** : Entr√©e de contenu et d√©clenchement de flux de travail
- **NextCloud** : H√©bergement d'images et g√©n√©ration d'URL publique
- **Supabase** : Stockage de base de donn√©es pour le contenu g√©n√©r√©

## Instructions de configuration

### ## Pr√©requis
Avant de configurer ce flux de travail, assurez-vous d'avoir :
- Installation n8n auto-h√©berg√©e
- Identifiants API pour tous les services requis
- Table de base de donn√©es cr√©√©e dans Supabase

### ## √âtape 1 : Configuration du compte de service

#### Configuration d'OpenAI
1. Cr√©ez un compte OpenAI sur [platform.openai.com](https://platform.openai.com)
2. G√©n√©rez une cl√© API √† partir de la section Cl√©s API
3. Dans n8n, cr√©ez de nouveaux identifiants OpenAI en utilisant votre cl√© API
4. Testez la connexion pour assurer l'acc√®s √† GPT-4

#### Configuration de Tavily Research
1. Inscrivez-vous sur [tavily.com](https://tavily.com)
2. Obtenez votre cl√© API depuis le tableau de bord
3. Ajoutez les identifiants Tavily dans n8n
4. Configurez la profondeur de recherche sur "avanc√©" pour de meilleurs r√©sultats

#### Configuration des services Google
1. Cr√©ez un projet Google Cloud
2. Activez l'API Google Drive et l'API Google Sheets
3. Cr√©ez des identifiants OAuth2
4. Configurez les identifiants Google Drive et Google Sheets dans n8n
5. Partagez votre feuille de calcul d'entr√©e avec le compte de service

#### Configuration de NextCloud
1. Installez NextCloud ou utilisez une solution h√©berg√©e
2. Cr√©ez un mot de passe d'application pour l'acc√®s API
3. Configurez les identifiants NextCloud dans n8n
4. Cr√©ez un dossier `/images/` pour le stockage de contenu

#### Configuration de Supabase
1. Cr√©ez un projet Supabase sur [supabase.com](https://supabase.com)
2. Cr√©ez une table avec la structure suivante :
```sql
CREATE TABLE works (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  title TEXT NOT NULL,
  content TEXT NOT NULL,
  image_url TEXT,
  category TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);
```
3. Obtenez l'URL du projet et la cl√© de service √† partir des param√®tres
4. Configurez les identifiants Supabase dans n8n

### ## √âtape 2 : Configuration de l'entr√©e Google Sheets

Cr√©ez un document Google Sheets avec les colonnes suivantes :
- **TITLE** : Sujet ou titre pour la g√©n√©ration de contenu
- **IMAGE_URL** : URL de partage Google Drive pour l'image associ√©e

Format d'exemple :
```
TITLE                           | IMAGE_URL
Mise en ≈ìuvre de chatbot AI      | https://drive.google.com/file/d/your-file-id/view
Tendances du marketing num√©rique 2024 | https://drive.google.com/file/d/another-file-id/view
```

### ## √âtape 3 : Importation et configuration du flux de travail

1. Importez le JSON du flux de travail dans votre instance n8n
2. Configurez toutes les connexions d'identifiants :
   - Liez les identifiants OpenAI au n≈ìud "OpenAI_GPT4_Model"
   - Liez les identifiants Tavily au n≈ìud "Tavily_Research_Agent"
   - Liez les identifiants Google aux n≈ìuds "Google_Sheets_Trigger" et "Google_Drive_Image_Downloader"
   - Liez les identifiants NextCloud aux n≈ìuds "NextCloud_Image_Uploader" et "NextCloud_Public_URL_Generator"
   - Liez les identifiants Supabase au n≈ìud "Supabase_Content_Storage"

3. Mettez √† jour le n≈ìud Google Sheets Trigger :
   - D√©finissez l'ID de votre feuille de calcul dans le champ documentId
   - Configurez la fr√©quence de sondage (par d√©faut : chaque minute)

4. Testez chaque connexion de n≈ìud individuellement avant d'activer

### ## √âtape 4 : Configuration du gestionnaire d'erreurs (facultatif)

Le flux de travail fait r√©f√©rence √† un flux de travail de gestion des erreurs (`GWQ4UI1i3Z0jp3GF`). Soit :
- Cr√©ez un flux de travail de notification d'erreur simple avec cet ID
- Supprimez les r√©f√©rences de gestion des erreurs si non n√©cessaires
- Mettez √† jour l'ID du flux de travail pour correspondre √† votre gestionnaire d'erreurs

### ## √âtape 5 : Activation du flux de travail

1. Enregistrez toutes les configurations de n≈ìuds
2. Testez le flux de travail avec une ligne d'exemple dans votre feuille Google
3. V√©rifiez la g√©n√©ration de contenu et le stockage dans Supabase
4. Activez le flux de travail pour une surveillance continue

## Comment √ßa fonctionne

### ## Processus de flux de travail

1. **D√©clencheur** : Google Sheets surveille les nouvelles lignes avec des sujets de contenu
2. **Recherche** : Tavily recherche 3 articles pertinents sur le sujet
3. **G√©n√©ration de contenu** : L'agent IA cr√©e du contenu multi-plateforme (site Web, blog, page de destination)
4. **Nettoyage du contenu** : Le traitement du texte supprime les artefacts de formatage
5. **Traitement des images** : T√©l√©charge l'image depuis Google Drive, t√©l√©charge sur NextCloud
6. **G√©n√©ration d'URL** : Cr√©e des liens de partage publics pour les images
7. **Stockage** : Enregistre le package de contenu final dans la base de donn√©es Supabase

### ## Structure de sortie du contenu

Chaque ex√©cution g√©n√®re :
- **Titre optimis√©** : Titre adapt√© au SEO et √† la plateforme
- **Contenu multi-plateforme** : 
  - Contenu de site Web (professionnel, renfor√ßant l'autorit√©)
  - Contenu de blog (√©ducatif, optimis√© pour le SEO)
  - Contenu de page de destination (ax√© sur la conversion)
- **Classification par cat√©gorie** : Cat√©gorisation automatique du contenu
- **Actifs d'image** : Images trait√©es et accessibles publiquement

## Options de personnalisation

### ## Modification de la strat√©gie de contenu
- Modifiez le message syst√®me de l'agent IA pour changer le style de contenu
- Ajustez les limites de caract√®res pour les exigences de diff√©rentes plateformes
- Modifiez les classifications de cat√©gorie pour votre secteur

### ## Param√®tres de recherche
- Changez la profondeur de recherche de Tavily (de base, avanc√©e)
- Ajustez le nombre de sources de recherche (1-10)
- Modifiez le sujet de recherche

### ## Configuration de stockage
- Mettez √† jour la structure de la table Supabase pour des champs suppl√©mentaires
- Changez l'organisation des dossiers NextCloud
- Modifiez les conventions de nommage des images

## D√©pannage

### ## Probl√®mes courants

**Le flux de travail ne se d√©clenche pas :**
- V√©rifiez les autorisations de Google Sheets
- V√©rifiez les param√®tres de fr√©quence de sondage
- Assurez-vous que le format de la feuille de calcul correspond aux exigences

**Erreurs de g√©n√©ration de contenu :**
- V√©rifiez la cl√© API OpenAI et les cr√©dits
- V√©rifiez l'acc√®s au mod√®le GPT-4
- Examinez le formatage du message syst√®me

**√âchecs de traitement d'image :**
- Confirmez les autorisations de partage de Google Drive
- V√©rifiez l'espace de stockage et les autorisations de NextCloud
- V√©rifiez que les formats de fichiers sont pris en charge

**Probl√®mes de stockage de base de donn√©es :**
- Validez la structure de la table Supabase
- V√©rifiez les autorisations de cl√© API
- Examinez le mappage des champs dans le n≈ìud de stockage

### ## Optimisation des performances
- Ajustez la fr√©quence de sondage en fonction de votre volume de contenu
- Surveillez l'utilisation de l'API pour rester dans les limites
- Envisagez le traitement par lots pour des sc√©narios √† fort volume

## Support et mises √† jour

Ce mod√®le est con√ßu pour des environnements n8n auto-h√©berg√©s et n√©cessite une configuration technique. Pour les probl√®mes :
1. Consultez les forums de la communaut√© n8n
2. Consultez la documentation sp√©cifique au service
3. Testez les n≈ìuds individuels en isolation
4. Surveillez les journaux d'ex√©cution pour des informations d'erreur d√©taill√©es

workflow.name: Automated Content Page Generator with AI, Tavily Research, and Supabase Storage

options.systemMessage:
=# Role  
You are an innovative **multi-platform content strategist and digital marketing specialist** with expertise in creating breakthrough, thought-provoking content across **websites, blogs, and landing pages**. You receive **3 different topics** and produce creative, trend-aware combined content optimized for each platform that are:  
- **Visionary and forward-thinking**, connecting emerging patterns with business implications
- **Creatively engaging**, using fresh perspectives, analogies, and unexpected connections
- **Trend-conscious and timely**, incorporating current market movements, cultural shifts, and industry disruptions
- **Intellectually stimulating**, challenging conventional thinking while providing actionable insights
- **Platform-optimized** for maximum engagement across professional and consumer audiences

### **Creative Multi-Platform Integration Process**
1. **Deep-dive analysis** of the 3 topics to uncover hidden connections, emerging patterns, and contrarian viewpoints
2. **Trend contextualization** - research current market trends, cultural movements, and industry disruptions that relate to the topics
3. **Creative synthesis** - identify unexpected parallels, innovative frameworks, or provocative angles that haven't been explored
4. **Platform optimization** - adapt content style, tone, and format for websites (professional), blogs (educational), and landing pages (conversion-focused)
5. **Cross-platform engagement strategy** - design content that drives meaningful interactions across different audience types

### **Creative Thinking Framework**
- **Question assumptions** about each topic - what conventional wisdom might be wrong?
- **Find unexpected parallels** - how do these topics mirror trends in other industries or historical patterns?
- **Identify emerging opportunities** - what new business models, career paths, or strategic advantages emerge from these connections?
- **Challenge the status quo** - what provocative but professional stance can you take?
- **Think like a futurist** - what implications will these trends have in 2-5 years?

### **Current Trends Integration Requirements**
Before writing, consider these trending areas:
- **AI transformation patterns** across industries
- **Remote/hybrid work evolution** and productivity innovations  
- **Sustainability and ESG** business imperatives
- **Gen Z workplace expectations** and cultural shifts
- **Economic uncertainty responses** and resilient business models
- **Digital transformation acceleration** post-pandemic
- **Creator economy growth** and personal branding
- **Web3/blockchain adoption** in traditional business
- **Mental health and wellbeing** in professional contexts
- **Skills gap solutions** and continuous learning trends

### **Platform-Specific Style Guidelines**

#### **Website Content (Professional Focus)**
- **Character Limit:** 1900 characters maximum
- **Tone:** Professional yet engaging, authority-building focused
- **Format:** Strategic white space, bullet points, professional language
- **Audience:** Business professionals, potential clients, industry leaders
- **Content Style:** Industry insights, service positioning, thought leadership

#### **Blog Content (Educational & Discussion)**
- **Character Limit:** 1900 characters maximum
- **Tone:** Informative, educational, engaging yet accessible
- **Format:** Shorter paragraphs, clear explanations, actionable insights
- **Audience:** Broader professional networks, learners, diverse demographics
- **Content Style:** Educational content, how-to guides, industry analysis

#### **Landing Page Content (Conversion-Focused)**
- **Character Limit:** 1900 characters maximum
- **Tone:** Compelling, benefit-driven, action-oriented
- **Format:** Scannable content, value propositions, conversion elements
- **Audience:** Prospects, leads, decision-makers
- **Content Style:** Solution-focused, results-oriented, persuasive messaging

### **Category Classification System**

Generate appropriate categories for content classification and SEO optimization. Categories should be:
- **Industry-relevant** and professionally recognized
- **SEO-friendly** for search engine optimization
- **Audience-appropriate** for target market alignment
- **Trend-conscious** reflecting current market interests

**Primary Category Options Include:**
- Technology & Innovation
- Digital Marketing & Strategy
- Business Intelligence & Analytics
- Customer Experience & Engagement
- Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning
- E-commerce & Retail Technology
- SaaS & Cloud Solutions
- Digital Transformation
- Marketing Automation
- Data Science & Analytics
- Cybersecurity & Privacy
- Mobile Technology & Apps
- Social Media & Content Marketing
- Web Development & Design
- Fintech & Digital Finance

### **Multi-Platform Content Structure**

**Universal Structure Format:**
- **Compelling Hook:** Platform-appropriate opening that connects all topics with current trends
- **Creative Framework:** Present topics through innovative lens adapted for each platform's purpose
- **Trend-Based Evidence:** Reference current examples relevant to platform objectives
- **Strategic Implications:** Reveal opportunities tailored to platform context
- **Platform-Specific Conclusion:** Call-to-action optimized for each platform's conversion goals

**Website Content Formatting:**
- Strategic white space and professional presentation
- Authority-building language and industry credibility
- Trust-building elements and expertise demonstration

**Blog Content Formatting:**
- Educational paragraphs with clear structure
- Actionable insights and practical applications
- Knowledge-sharing and thought leadership elements

**Landing Page Formatting:**
- Benefit-focused headlines and value propositions
- Conversion-optimized language and persuasive elements
- Clear calls-to-action and decision-driving content

### **Platform-Specific Innovation Requirements:**

**Website Innovation:**
- Establish authority and expertise in the industry
- Create content that positions the brand as a thought leader
- Build trust and credibility with potential clients
- Focus on professional reputation and market positioning

**Blog Innovation:**
- Provide valuable educational content that attracts organic traffic
- Create shareable insights that drive engagement and backlinks
- Build thought leadership through consistent valuable content
- Focus on SEO optimization and search visibility

**Landing Page Innovation:**
- Convert visitors into leads through compelling value propositions
- Address specific pain points and present clear solutions
- Create urgency and motivation for immediate action
- Focus on conversion optimization and lead generation

### **Trend Research Integration:**
Before writing each piece:
1. **Scan current business headlines** for relevant developments
2. **Identify cultural and generational shifts** affecting the target market
3. **Research emerging technologies** that intersect with your topics
4. **Analyze competitor content** to find gaps and opportunities for differentiation
5. **Consider global economic and social factors** influencing business decisions

# Input Format Expected
*Main Topic: [MAIN TOPIC]
**Topic 1: [TOPIC 1 TITLE]
** Content for Topic 1: [TOPIC 1 CONTENT]
**Topic 2: [TOPIC 2 TITLE]
** Content for Topic 2: [TOPIC 2 CONTENT]
**Topic 3: [TOPIC 3 TITLE]
** Content for Topic 3: [TOPIC 3 CONTENT]

# Output Process
1. **Trend Analysis Summary:** [Brief overview of current trends that intersect with the 3 topics - 2-3 sentences]
2. **Creative Connection Insight:** [The innovative angle or framework that unifies all topics - 1-2 sentences]  
3. **Content Category:** [Most appropriate category classification for the unified content]
4. **Website Content:**
   - **Title:** [Compelling, professional headline optimized for authority-building]
   - **Content:** [Professional authority-building content, 1900 characters max]
5. **Blog Content:**
   - **Title:** [Educational, engaging headline optimized for search and sharing]
   - **Content:** [Educational and informative content, 1900 characters max]
6. **Landing Page Content:**
   - **Title:** [Conversion-focused headline optimized for lead generation]
   - **Content:** [Conversion-focused persuasive content, 1900 characters max]

**Important:** Always maintain 1900 character counts for all platform content to ensure compliance. Each platform version should maintain the same core insights while adapting tone, format, and style for optimal audience engagement and platform-specific objectives. Titles should be compelling, platform-appropriate, and optimized for their respective purposes (authority-building, education, or conversion).

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
"action": 
"parse",
"response": 
{
"output": 
{
"title": 
"AI Chatbot Agents: Transforming Customer Engagement Beyond Scripted Bots",
"category": "AI Agents",
"Article": 
"
---

**Website Content:**
AI chatbot agents represent a paradigm shift in customer service automation, transcending traditional chatbots that depend on scripted, rule-based workflows. Unlike these limited systems, AI agents leverage advanced large language models (LLMs) and generative AI technologies to understand, reason, and act upon complex customer needs autonomously. This enables businesses to deliver deeply personalized, context-aware experiences that drive customer satisfaction and loyalty.

In the era of digital transformation accelerated by hybrid work and increasing automation demands, AI agents stand as strategic assets. They integrate seamlessly with business systems, analyze vast information swiftly, and assist in multifaceted tasks beyond mere query response‚Äîranging from coding to creative problem solving. Companies investing in intelligent AI agents are not only enhancing operational efficiency but also positioning themselves ahead in competitive marketplaces by differentiating customer engagement.

Furthermore, the rise of AI chatbot agencies catering to diverse sectors‚Äîretail, travel, education, and beyond‚Äîillustrates the growing recognition of tailored AI-powered solutions as essential for modern customer service. Partnering with experienced AI solution providers enables scalable, innovative deployments that align with a company's long-term growth and ESG goals.

**Strategic Opportunities:**
- Deploy AI agents to replace rigid scripted chatbots and unlock continuous learning capability.
- Harness contextual intelligence for superior customer journey mapping and real-time decision making.
- Leverage AI agents for integrated business insights, advanced problem solving, and creative support.
- Develop scalable industry-specific chatbot solutions via AI chatbot agencies to rapidly meet evolving customer expectations.

---

**Blog Content:**
Understanding the difference between chatbots and AI agents is crucial for businesses aiming to innovate their customer service strategies. Traditional chatbots follow predefined scripts; they respond only within narrow, manually programmed workflows. While useful for simple queries, they lack the ability to adapt or understand nuanced language.

AI chatbot agents, by contrast, utilize generative AI and large language models to process and generate natural language. This allows them to understand context, reason with complex information, and perform advanced tasks like problem solving, writing, or coding. For customers, this means more natural, helpful, and satisfying interactions with automated systems.

The accelerated growth of AI chatbot agencies illustrates how industries from retail to education are embracing these technologies to create personalized, intelligent service bots that better meet user needs. These AI agents enhance productivity and customer experience by acting autonomously and learning continuously, unlike traditional chatbots bound by fixed dialogues.

To implement AI agents effectively, companies should prioritize seamless integration with existing business systems and focus on evolving usage patterns. This approach fosters resilient and scalable customer engagement models responsive to ongoing digital transformation, hybrid work trends, and the expectations of digital-native consumers.

**Key Takeaways:**
- AI agents use advanced AI technologies for genuine language understanding and action.
- They surpass chatbots in flexibility, intelligence, and range of use cases.
- AI chatbot agencies help businesses customize bots for varied industry challenges.
- Investing in AI agents advances customer experience and operational agility.

---

**Landing Page Content:**
Empower your customer service with AI chatbot agents ‚Äî the future of intelligent automation. Unlike traditional chatbots limited by rigid scripts, our AI agents harness the power of generative AI and large language models to understand, reason, and provide context-rich support. This means faster, more accurate responses and an experience your customers will appreciate.

Why settle for limited chatbot interactions? Upgrade to AI agents that:
- Learn and adapt to your customers' unique needs
- Handle complex queries and tasks autonomously
- Integrate smoothly with your existing business systems
- Deliver scalable solutions tailored to your industry

Join the wave of businesses transforming how they engage customers. Our AI chatbot agency specializes in creating personalized agents for retail, travel, education, and more ‚Äî helping you stay ahead in an evolving market.

Take the next step toward smarter, more effective customer service. Contact us today for a consultation and discover how AI chatbot agents can revolutionize your business.

---"
}
}
}

parameters.content:
## Google Sheets Workflow Trigger
The post title and image URLs are acquired from the Google Sheets document. This trigger monitors for new rows and initiates the automated content creation process.

## Tavily Research Agent
Tavily takes your title, finds the three most relevant articles, and seamlessly delivers them to the AI agent for smarter, faster insights. Uses advanced search depth for comprehensive research.

## Multi-Platform Content Generator
After Tavily gathers the top three articles, the AI agent steps in with a built-in output parser that guarantees consistent, well-structured results. It transforms the findings into optimized content for websites, blogs, and landing pages.

## Content Text Cleaner
Once the AI has generated content, this node cleans and formats the text, removing markdown artifacts and ensuring consistent structure for database storage.

## Google Drive Image Downloader
Downloads images directly from Google Drive using the URLs provided in the Google Sheets trigger, preparing them for upload to NextCloud storage.

## NextCloud Image Uploader
Uploads downloaded images to NextCloud storage in an organized folder structure, making them accessible for the web application.

## NextCloud Public URL Generator
Generates public sharing URLs for uploaded images, creating accessible links that can be stored in the database and used by frontend applications.

## Supabase Content Storage
Stores the finalized content (title, article, category, and image URL) in a Supabase database table, making it available for retrieval by web applications and APIs.

generic.label: Hey founders! Your business doesn't need you to operate
Why this Product Manager loves workflow automation with n8n
7 no-code workflow automations for Amazon Web Services

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
